snippet: As the attorney general asked the state’s highest court to suspend a ruling striking down the state’s ban on same-sex marriage, some Arkansas county clerks issued marriage licenses to gay couples.
abstract: Gay couples in many Arkansas cities rush to get married as the attorney general asks the state's highest court to suspend ruling striking down the state's ban on same-sex marriages.

byline.contributor: Steve Barnes contributed reporting from Little Rock, Ark.

lead_paragraph: As the attorney general asked the state’s highest court to suspend a ruling striking down the state’s ban on same-sex marriage, some Arkansas county clerks issued marriage licenses to gay couples.

headline.main: Same-Sex Couples in Arkansas Rush to Wed as Court Ruling Provides an Opening
headline.print_headline: Same-Sex Couples in Arkansas Rush to Wed as Court Ruling Provides an Opening

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
